column1: That night after the lights had been extinguished
column4: thinking over the events of the evening
column5: beginning with the Council Fire and ending with the little scene that had taken place in their tent. What should she do? What was the honest course to pursue? The girl was unable to decide. She did make up her mind
column7: to consult with Miss Elting on the following morning.After breakfast at the first opportunity she went in search of Miss Elting
column8: but learned that the guardian in company with another of the camp officials had started out with Jasper to go to "The Pines
column9: a summer watering place in the woods, some ten miles from Camp Wau-Wau. This summer resort was reached by a state road entering the woods from another direction, but the two young women had taken the log road as being the most direct.
